Description: Bronze kohl-stick; cast with a central moulding intended as the grip; traces of linen attached. Used with jar no.39 in collection.
Curator's comments: No Ethnography Dept. Register Slip. British and Medieval Register, v.8 (1898-1905), pp.124-125. Nos.2 to 43 given as "Coptic, El Azam find." Collection 1902,5-29 is initially described as being acquired in exchange from Mihran Sivadjian, with nos.2 to 19 in the collection being purchased from Henry Wallis - but a pencilled annotation dated 1975 indicates that all of nos.2 to 43 were probably acquired from Wallis as no reference to them was found in correspondence with Sivadjian; the only Savadjian item being no.1. (AMD,2/1997). In set with Af1902,0529.39
